htmlBody:
You won't remember all the breathless EA forum posts, the in-fighting, and the crisis management. You'll just remember that you either kept your faith in the cause and the community -- or you didn't. 

This part was particularly good at shifting my perspective. Thank you, Geoffrey.
I wonder what changes gets implemented after this moment of shift in EA? That is worth talking about too in 5 years or 10 years..

How short are your AI timelines btw?




edit: clarifying that I'm not being serious, and that I broadly agree with the post.

I think EA will recover from the FTX debacle long before we get AGI.

More seriously, I think we'll get 'transformational narrow AI' of various sorts long before we develop true AGI. But that's a long story, for another time.

I think the legacy of the FTX crisis will depend on whether it was a one time freak event, or if it was merely the first of many scandals. I'm not confident in survival if EA manages to get scammed by another dodgy billionaire, it might end up in a collection of splinter groups.
